intro: Struthanthus dichotrianthus var. lasserianus, commonly known as the Lasser's flaxflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has linear, grass-like leaves and produces small, seed-like fruits. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its unique floral display.
